stories.text:
I turned of my ad blocker for a while today. It disables most cookie banners (or auto clicks them, I don't know). So while it was off, I was bombarded with cookie banners.

What I noticed is how much more aggressive they are in Europ.

On US sites, the banner is usually a smallish banner on the bottom.

On European sites, the banner is usually a giant "in your face" banner in the center of the screen.

Examples:

US: https://www.cnet.com/news/

Europe: https://www.heise.de/

US: https://www.nytimes.com/

Europe: https://www.spiegel.de

Why this difference? Aren't they all trying to comply with the GDPR?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are cookie banners in Europe much more aggressive than in America?
